intro: Weberbauerocereus, commonly known as the night-blooming cereus, is a genus of cacti native to South America. It is characterized by its spiny stems and nocturnal flowers that open at night. The plants typically have a cylindrical or branching shape and are adapted to arid environments. Their flowers are usually large, fragrant, and white or pale in color. Weberbauerocereus species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and unique blooming behavior.
